title: The cost price of 10 apples is equal to the selling price of 12 apples. What is the gain or lose percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price of 10 apples be ₹ x Then, selling price of 12 apples ( SP) = ₹ x (given) Cost price of 12 apples (CP)= x * 12 / 10 = 1.2 x % Loss = (CP of 12 apples - SP of 12 apples) * 100 / CP of 12 apples. So, % loss = (1.2 x - x ) * 100 / 1.2 x = 0.2 x * 100 / 1.2 x = 20 / 1.2 = 16.67 % Answer
If C is the cost price per Apple & S the selling price per apple, 10C=12S C=12S/10 =6S/5 Gain on Sale =S-C=S-6S/5 =-S/5 Percentage of gain =-(S/5)/(6S/5)*100=-100/6 or -16.25% Or a Loss of 16.25%
